lab09

Class Maze

  • java.lang.Object
    • lab09.Maze

  • public class Maze
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates a Maze object from a text file as array of cell objects, and start and finish locations

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Maze(java.lang.String filename)
      Reads and constructs maze from file

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void buildPath()
      Retraces steps from finish to start to rebuild the search path; if called before finish is reached in the search, no path is built
      Position finish()
      returns finish position
      boolean isClear(Position p)
      check if location is a clear location in the maze
      boolean isOnPath(Position p)
      returns true if the position is on the final path; method buildPath() must be run first to generate this path
      protected boolean isValid(Position p)
      determines if position exists in maze
      boolean isVisited(Position p)
      returns true if the position has been visited
      void setPrevious(Position p, Position prev)
      Set a pointer from Position p back to Position prev
      java.lang.String showPath()
      Builds and displays maze with visited locations marked
      Position start()
      returns start position
      java.lang.String toString()
      Displays maze with visited locations marked
      void visit(Position p)
      cell at position p is set to visited

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Maze

        public Maze(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads and constructs maze from file
        Parameters:
        filename - at which the maze is stored, in which first line contains number of rows, # is a wall, 's' marks the start, and 'f' marks the finish.

    • Method Detail

      • visit

        public void visit(Position p)
        cell at position p is set to visited
        Parameters:
        p - a position within the maze

        returns true if the position has been visited
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if position has been visited

                        Position prev)
        Set a pointer from Position p back to Position prev
        Parameters:
        p - a Position
        prev - the previous position

      • isOnPath

        public boolean isOnPath(Position p)
        returns true if the position is on the final path; method buildPath() must be run first to generate this path
        Parameters:
        p - the position
        Returns:
        true if position is on final path

        protected boolean isValid(Position p)
        determines if position exists in maze
        Parameters:

      • isClear

        public boolean isClear(Position p)
        check if location is a clear location in the maze

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Displays maze with visited locations marked
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representing maze state in which "." is used to mark visited non-start/finish locations

      • buildPath

        public void buildPath()
        Retraces steps from finish to start to rebuild the search path; if called before finish is reached in the search, no path is built

      • showPath

        public java.lang.String showPath()
        Builds and displays maze with visited locations marked
        Returns:
        String representing maze state in which "." is used to mark visited non-start/finish locations
